name: 51 Peg
scenarioDescription:
The 51 Peg Exoplanetary System


Overview

51 Peg is a star with 1.12 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.2 times its radius. It is located 50.46 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

51 Peg is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 51 Peg system


51 Peg b

51 Peg b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 51 Peg b is 150.096 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 51 Peg b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 51 Peg, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Haute-Provence Observatory.
